column4: Refiner Phillips 66 profit beats as chemicals unit outperforms
column5: (Reuters) - U.S. oil refiner Phillips 66PSX.N posted a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday, helped by a 28 percent rise in net income from its chemicals unit.
column6: The refiner’s chemicals joint venture with Chevron Corp had fully recovered from Hurricane Harvey and contributed to first-quarter earnings, Chief Executive Greg Garland said.
column7: The U.S. shale boom has opened enormous reservoirs of cheap natural gas, a raw material for chemicals and plastics. The chemicals unit’s net income rose to $232 million from $181 million.
column8: However, earnings from the company’s main refining business fell nearly 65 percent to $91 million.
column9: Excluding one-time items, the company earned $1.04 per share, beating analysts’ average estimate of 89 cents, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S.
column10: Rival Valero Energy Corp VLO.N reported quarterly results on Thursday and attributed its better-than-expected profit to higher refining margins.

column5: HOUSTON (Reuters) - Independent U.S. refiner Phillips 66 PSX.N expects its nine refineries to run in the mid-90-percent range of their combined crude oil processing capacity of 1.6 million barrel per day (bpd) in the second quarter of 2018, company Chief Financial Officer Kevin Mitchell said on Friday.
column6: Phllips 66 expects to spend between $90 million and $120 million on refinery maintenance in the second quarter, Mitchell said.

column5: April 27 (Reuters) - U.S. oil refiner Phillips 66 reported a 2 percent fall in first-quarter profit on Friday, hurt by higher costs.

column4: Phillips 66 restarting JV Borger, Texas refinery gasoline units -sources
column5: HOUSTON (Reuters) - Phillips 66 was restarting the gasoline-producing units at its 146,000-barrel-per-day (bpd) Borger, Texas, refinery on Monday, said sources familiar with plant operations.
column6: All other units at the Borger refinery have restarted following a planned overhaul that finished last week, the sources said.
column7: Phillips 66 said on Monday that planned maintenance was under way at the refinery, but declined to say which units were involved.
column8: The two 30,000-bpd catalytic cracking units were shut on April 11 because of a malfunction on the hydrotreater serving both units, according to the sources. The hydrotreater restarted over the weekend.
column9: The Borger refinery is a 50-50 joint venture between Phillips 66 and Cenovus Energy. Phillips 66 is the managing partner.
